00313 // These are ugly, but necessary utility functions we must use to generate a
00314 // unique identifier inside of the PARAM() module.
00315 #define JOIN(x, y) JOIN_AGAIN(x, y)
00316 #define JOIN_AGAIN(x, y) x ## y
00317 
00333 #ifdef __COUNTER__
00334   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::util::Option<T> \
00335       JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __COUNTER__) \
00336       (false, DEF, ID, DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00337 
00339   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static \
00340       mlpack::util::Option<bool> JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __COUNTER__) \
00341       (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00342 
00344 #else
00345   // We have to do some really bizarre stuff since __COUNTER__ isn't defined.  I
00346   // don't think we can absolutely guarantee success, but it should be "good
00347   // enough".  We use the __LINE__ macro and the type of the parameter to try
00348   // and get a good guess at something unique.
00349   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::util::Option<T> \
00350       JOIN(JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __LINE__), opt) (false, DEF, ID, \
00351       DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00352 
00354   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static \
00355       mlpack::util::Option<bool> JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __LINE__) \
00356       (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00357 
00359 #endif
